name: Prawn Malai Curry
author: Niloufer
summary: This delicious, mild curry is so easy to make. The word 'malai' means cream, but this curry gets its creaminess from coconut milk. This is a recipe from Bengal, which is famous for its seafood. Serve it with steamed basmati rice.
ingredients: 1 pound tiger prawns, peeled and deveined
directions: Prepare the fresh garam masala: in a coffee grinder, grind the cardamom seeds, 3 whole cloves, and 3 cinnamon sticks to a fine powder
Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add the 4 whole cloves, 4 cardamom pods, and 2 sticks of cinnamon and fry for a few seconds (take care as cloves tend to pop out of the pan)
Stir in the grated onion and reduce the heat to medium-low
Cook and stir until the liquid dries and the onion no longer smells raw, about 5 minutes
Add the ginger paste and garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly
Stir in the turmeric and cayenne pepper
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes are soft, about 5 minutes
Pour in the water, cover the pan, and cook for an additional 5 minutes
Pour in the coconut milk and stir well
When the mixture is just below boiling, stir in the prawns
Sprinkle the mixture with almost all of the fresh garam masala powder, reserving a pinch to use as a garnish
Do not cover the pan at this stage, as the coconut milk will curdle
As soon as the prawns are pink and cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes, add the ghee
Remove the pan from the heat
Sprinkle the reserved garam masala over the dish and serve
